nodes.title: Article 1
nodes.summary: This partial document defines two key terms within a mining regulation: 1) "marketable mining product," which refers to commercially viable mineral substances extracted or processed according to a specified nomenclature, and 2) "less processed marketable mining product," which is an intermediate product obtained during approved mineral or metallurgical treatment processes.

nodes.title: Article 11
nodes.summary: This partial document contains the final articles and administrative details of an interministerial decree (Arrêté) from the Democratic Republic of Congo, dated August 4, 2023. It specifies the government officials and agencies responsible for executing the decree, which regulates the commercialization, export, and classification of marketable mining products. The decree comes into force on the date of its signature. The text includes a disclaimer stating that the published texts are provided by associations and do not engage their responsibility.

nodes.title: Article 2
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the ownership and export rights for marketable mining products. It states that such products belong to the holders of the relevant exploitation permits or agreements. It lists the entities considered as holders, including mining rights holders, processing entities, approved trading houses, approved mining cooperatives, and traders. Crucially, it specifies that only mining rights holders, processing entities, and approved trading houses are authorized to export these marketable mining products.

nodes.title: Article 4
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the classification system for marketable mining products. It establishes that the official list is defined in an annex, which is an integral part of the ministerial order. The annex contains nine categories, and for each product, it specifies the recoverable substances, applicable grade ranges, specific grades to apply, and recovery rates. The nine listed categories are: Metals, Precious Metals, Salts, Alloys, Simple Concentrates, Mixed Concentrates, Other Products, Rare Earths, and Raw Ores and Concentrates for local sales.

nodes.title: Article 7
nodes.summary: This partial document covers Article 7 of a mining code or regulation. Its main points are: the Minister of Mines can prohibit the export of certain commercial mining products, specifically banning the export of copper and cobalt concentrates; under a special derogation, mining rights holders may be authorized to export less-processed products for one year due to technical or economic factors; and authorized operators must provide detailed lists of valuable mineral substances in each export shipment, adhering to thresholds set in a referenced annex.
